intro: Cogniauxiocharis euphlebia, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, sunny environments and is often found in disturbed soils. Its fibrous roots and hairy foliage contribute to its adaptability in various ecological settings.
